title: Ticket #1290: MyString that concatenates with self produces incorrect answer
description:
This fails: 

MyString foo("bar");
foo += foo;

foo is now, incorrectly, "bar", instead of "barbar".

The unit test output: 

TEST:  Test concatenating a non-empty MyString with itself.
INPUT:
    MyString:  foo
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  foofoo
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  foo
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 1645

2010-Mar-25 16:11:36 by adesmet:
I've also reproduced the segfault psilord saw on "Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 5.4 (Tikanga)" on a 32-bit Intel box. I'm guessing the problem is that "Data+Len" overlaps with "Data" at the very last byte (the NUL terminated string). strcpy's man page warns me that "The strings [dest and src] may not overlap...."
